forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 4am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
As midnight gently fades into the early hours, the atmosphere over Downtown San Francisco carries a quiet uncertainty. The night, still holding onto a whisper of rain, hovers around a cool 48 degrees. The breeze from the west northwest brushes against the skin, invigorating yet brisk, with gusts that hint at the potential splendor of the day to come. There is promise in the air, albeit a faint one, with a mere flicker of a chance for raindrops to grace the pavement before dawn.

As morning unfolds, the clouds will retreat, surrendering to the sun’s warm embrace. A palette of bright blue hues shall illuminate the day, beckoning residents to step outside into the fresh air. Temperatures will peak at a pleasant 59 degrees, gradually easing into a cooler 56 by afternoon, the kind of day that feels both crisp and refreshing. The northwesterly wind will accompany the sun, suggesting layers might be wise; a light jacket, or perhaps a cozy sweater, will provide just the right comfort as one steps out to explore the city. With these conditions, an invigorating walk through Golden Gate Park or a leisurely visit to a local cafe could be just the ticket—simple pleasures that invite one to savor the beauty of a San Francisco day without the chaos of busyness.
